description: This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather Lindsay during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor.New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe today!

image.title: This Is Life with Heather & Cornelius

items.content:
A recent “Pop The Balloon Or Find Love” clip from the creator Arlette Amuli sparked the deep and important conversation about your relationship with God within other realtionships. Heather and Cornelius are digging into standards, control, and leadership.

items.title: Do We Truly Want To Be Led?

items.content:
What does tit for tat do to a relationship? Heather and Cornelius are giving the his and hers perspective to what confiding in your partner and others looks like. Is there a double standard when it comes to men and women sharing info with their friends and family? Finally, Heather is turning over a new leaf… listen in to find out what the final straw was. 

Thank you to this week’s sponsors:

items.title: Is It Tit For Tat In Relationships?

items.content:
What are you using to help self soothe? What is that line where it can become unhealthy? Heather and Cornelius dig into their experiences and what they have learned to recognize and adjust.

items.title: Is It Self Soothing Or Self Sabotaging?

items.content:
What does fighting for your marriage look like? Heather and Cornelius chat individual martial roles and when it feels like what you are contributing is never enough. With the example of a recent birthday party things become a little clearer.

items.title: What I Do Is Never Enough

items.content:
How can we be there for those experiencing rock bottom? Cornelius sits down for a heart to heart with those looking to support their friends through mental health ups and downs. Finally, things get a little emotional sharing what he has learned to be the most solid question to ask. 

Thank you to this week's sponsors!

items.title: How Can I Be A Friend To You?

items.content:
A recent listener question gives Cornelius the opportunity to open up the complex discussion “what does a relationship with God look like?”. He shares his struggles and the process of freeing himself from the expectations of others.

items.title: Am I Slowly Drifting Away From God?

items.content:
How long is too long to be with a partner until they propose? Heather and Cornelius ask the question in a time when it feels like dating and relationships are all over the place. Cornelius let's the audience in on a the male perspective and decoding a few common phrases. Visit us @:Instagram Heather LindseyCornelius LindseySabbath LAExecutive Producers are Riley Peleuses + Ryan Kershner for YEA Networks / YEA PodcastsIf you are interested in advertising on this podcast or having Cornelius & Heather as guests on your Podcast, Radio Show, or TV Show, reach out to podcast@yeanetworks.com

items.content:
Heather and Cornelius are continuing the conversation of "the prize" when it comes to a relationship. Simone Biles and Johnathan Owens created buzz around this idea and the Lindsey's had to weigh in. What does being "the prize" mean in a relationship? Should there be a "prize"? Bring your fan, this one gets a little heated. Visit us @:Instagram Heather LindseyCornelius LindseySabbath LAExecutive Producers are Riley Peleuses + Ryan Kershner for YEA Networks / YEA PodcastsIf you are interested in advertising on this podcast or having Cornelius & Heather as guests on your Podcast, Radio Show, or TV Show, reach out to podcast@yeanetworks.com

items.title: Supporting Your Partner's Mental Health

items.content:
Trust is so hard these days! Trust the timing of when you will find your partner, have kids, land your dream job...really all of it! Heather and Cornelius share their journey to giving up control and trusting God's timing. Bring your pen and paper because Heather and Cornelius have some tips for y'all. Thank you to this week's sponsors:BetterHelp - This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. Give online therapy a try atbetterhelp.com/LINDSEYS and get on your way to being your best self.Chime - Start building your credit. Open a Chime Checking account with at least a $200 qualifying direct deposit to get started. Get started at chime.com/lwtl. Visit us @:Instagram Heather LindseyCornelius LindseySabbath LAExecutive Producers are Riley Peleuses + Ryan Kershner for YEA Networks / YEA PodcastsIf you are interested in advertising on this podcast or having Cornelius & Heather as guests on your Podcast, Radio Show, or TV Show, reach out to podcast@yeanetworks.com

items.title: Catch Up With Us!

items.content:

This week, Cornelius is sharing some of his most embarrassing moments and what he learned from them. items.title: Finding Freedom!

items.content:
Happy Holidays and New Year! We are taking a moment to look back at this year of growth, learning, and blessings. From big life changes to taking leaps of faith we appreciate y'all rocking with us. items.content:
Cuddly as a cactus and charming as an eel, he’s your new favorite snarky talk show host. JoinThe Grinch (and his faithful dog Max) each week as he rants against Christmas cheer androasts celebrity guests like chestnuts on an open fire. Starring Saturday Night Live’s JamesAustin Johnson as the notorious curmudgeon and broadcasting straight from Who-Ville, willThe Grinch send these famous folks back down Mt. Crumpit, or will they soften his stanceagainst Christmas and grow his heart three sizes? Grab your hot cocoa and cozy slippers andlisten along to find out!Listen to ‘Tis The Grinch Holiday Talk Show: http://wondery.fm/TIL_tisthegrinch
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Marriage Advice Through the Years

items.content:
This week Heather and Cornelius talk about the arguments they’ve had in their marriage. They discuss many of the mistakes they’ve made. They talk about how they’ve learned to converse with each other without hitting below the belt. If you and your partner can’t communicate, LISTEN TO THIS TOGETHER. It’s funny and enlightening.Thank you to this week's sponsor:BetterHelp - This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. items.title: Arguing vs Constructive Communication in Marriage

items.content:
Heather and Cornelius celebrated 13 years of marriage recently and they are back to talk about the last couple years of their marriage. They talk about expectations, learning how to converse with each other, dealing with inner trauma, deciding not to get divorced, learning how to trust again and so much more. Whether you're married, engaged, dating or living single in these streets, there's something for you.Thank you to this week's sponsors:BetterHelp - This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. items.title: When Marriage Counseling Starts Hurting Your Relationship

items.content:
Cornelius and Heather continue their marriage discussion. This week they talk about losing control and stop treating your spouse like a child. They talk about submission and what’s really causing the control issues. This is one episode you want to listen with your spouse, person you’re dating or that friend you have your eye on. This is a great date night podcast.Thank you to this week's sponsors BetterHelp - This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. They talk about submission and what’s really causing the control issues. This is one episode you want to listen with your spouse, person you’re dating or that friend you have your eye on. This is a great date night podcast.

Thank you to this week's sponsors

items.content:
This is the third and final part to the Call Me Out On My Crap Series and Heather and Cornelius leave it all out on the table as they continue their honest and open talk about marriage and relationships. In this episode, they call each other out on their crap! It’s easy to see yourself one way, but how does your spouse see you? They ask each other. Listen to this truly raw conversation. Thank you to this week's sponsor:BetterHelp - This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. items.title: Call Me Out On My Crap!

items.content:
This is part 2 of the hard but necessary conversations you have in a marriage. It can be tough. Heather and Cornelius have had their fair share of ups and downs. One conversation destroyed their fantasy and forced them to be real with each other. Listen as they talk about it. This is a real conversation that’s truly authentic. Listen and be encouraged.Thank you to this week's sponsors:BetterHelp - “This episode is sponsored by/brought to you by BetterHelp. items.title: How to Walk Alongside Someone with Depression

items.content:
In this episode, Cornelius dives deeper into his journey of depression. He shares more about his fight with staying alive, feeling worn out and having nowhere to turn. He talks about taking medication and using edibles to cope. This is a VERY emotional episode where he shares a lot of his feelings.Thank you to this week's sponsors: BetterHelp - This episode is brought to you by BetterHelp. Give online therapy a try atwww.betterhelp.com/LINDSEYS and get on your way to being your best self.We would love your feedback... If you enjoyed this episode, tell us why! items.title: How Are Those New Years Goals Going?

items.content:
Cornelius was told that knowing about his father was the missing piece. Two weeks later, Heather spoke to her father for the first time, and he told her she was the missing piece. They talk about their experiences and discuss what it felt like to live in deprivation. They also encourage others who’ve been in their situation.Thank you to this week's sponsors:BETTERHELP - This episode is sponsored by BetterHelp. items.content:
Holidays can be difficult. Sitting around the table with family you dislike is highly likely. There’s at one uncle that loves to talk about politics, the bougie aunt who looks down on everyone and everything, the cousin that cannot get his/her life together, the cousin who’s still searching for identity and the family secrets that lurk in the background. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about all this and more in this special holiday episode.We would love your feedback... If you enjoyed this episode, tell us why! items.title: Lindseys in Israel

items.content:
Keke Palmer has questions for days, about everything under the sun. From the existential to the inconsequential. From pop culture to pop science. From the meaning of life to the meaning of W.A.P. From life in outer space to “Where the eff is Tom from MySpace?“ And everything in between. Because Baby, this is Keke Palmer, and she is here for All. Of. It.  Each week, the multi-talented Keke is taking you on a journey down the rabbit hole on a topic that she cannot stop obsessing over. She’ll also get deep with special guests, trying to answer the questions that keep us up at night. We are getting INTO IT. Listen to Baby, this is Keke Palmer Only on Amazon Music:  www.amazon.com/BTIKP_us_pfd_AA_110122
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

While we may not want to believe it, the truth is that our actions prove we know more than God. The mouth speaks one thing, but the actions prove another. items.title: I Know More Than God!

items.content:
When you grow up without a healthy understanding of God, sin, punishment, love, and repentance, you’ll start thinking that you’re never enough. You’ll do everything you can to live up to a perfect standard that has no ceiling. Listen as Cornelius breaks down his pathway switch in this stirring and impactful talk.HelloFresh - Go to HelloFresh.com/lwl65 and use code lwl65 for 65% off plus free shipping!BetterHelp - Visit BetterHelp.com/lindseys today to get 10% off your first month.We would love your feedback... items.title: I’m Not Enough, & I Deserve to Die

items.content:
An unhealthy soul will have an unhealthy view of success. Nothing in life is ever enough, and you’re always on a quest to prove to yourself and others you belong. This has been Cornelius’ story, and he shares his addiction to performance and his fight with unconsciousness in this relatable talk.Thank you to this week's sponsors:HelloFresh - Go to HelloFresh.com/lwl65 and use code lwl65 for 65% off plus free shipping!Forager Project - To find these delicious Kids yogurts near you, visit foragerproject.comWe would love your feedback... items.title: Look at Me!

items.content:
The truth will set you free, but it will hurt! The truth isn't always comforting, but it must be heard and received for change to take place. If not, you'll continue your self-sabotaging ways. Listen as Cornelius shares more of his journey of self-sabotage and accountability.Thank you to this week's sponsors Chime - Get started at chime.com/lwtlBetterHelp - Visit BetterHelp.com/lindseys today to get 10% off your first monthWe would love your feedback... items.title: Don't Give Up!

items.content:
When Emily Gellis hears rumors of people suffering horrible side effects from a trendy diet she springs into action. Armed with over a hundred thousand Instagram followers, Emily launches a social media crusade to expose F-Factor and its founder, Tanya Zuckerbrot. It’s the start of a feud that will attract trolls, lawyers, and, eventually, national media all because of fiber. From Wondery, this is a story about wealth, wellness, and influence hosted by Casey Wilson.Listen to Fed Up: wondery.fm/LWTL_FedUp
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes.summary:
When Emily Gellis hears rumors of people suffering horrible side effects from a trendy diet she springs into action. Armed with over a hundred thousand Instagram followers, Emily launches a social media crusade to expose F-Factor and its founder, Tanya Zuckerbrot. It’s the start of a feud that will attract trolls, lawyers, and, eventually, national media all because of fiber. From Wondery, this is a story about wealth, wellness, and influence hosted by Casey Wilson.Listen to Fed Up: wondery.fm/LWTL_FedUp

items.title: Where Is My Answered Prayer?!

items.content:
In today’s inaugural Season two episode, Lauren is inviting on psychotherapist and New York Times bestselling author of Maybe You Should Talk to Someone, Lori Gottlieb! The two dive in right away as Lauren asks Lori if she always envisioned being a counselor and how to create incredible connections with others through storytelling and music. The pair also chat about: what Lori believes drives the narrative of isolation, Lauren’s personal story with counseling and mental health, how to identify what ‘wise compassion’ is, the difference between productive anxiety vs unproductive anxiety, and exactly where to start to breed more compassion. If you’re ready to understand a little more about yourself, and those around you, to ultimately cultivate deeper relationships - this episode is for you. In addition to her clinical practice, Lori writes The Atlantic’s weekly “Dear Therapist” advice column and is co-host of the popular “Dear Therapists” podcast produced by Katie Couric. Listen here: wondery.fm/Lindseys_DaigleBites
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: What Every Marriage Needs to Hear

items.content:
A big Halloween party at an apartment complex in Redmond, Washington. Themed rooms and costumed partygoers. But by the end of the party, one of the hosts is dead. The police look to the partiers as the prime suspects: was it the guy in the devil mask, the bank robber, the construction worker? As investigators comb through forensic evidence, witness testimony, DNA, and even consult with a psychic, they zero in on one suspect in particular. But for what reason? Host and reporter Matthew Shaer (Over My Dead Body) returns to the scene of the crime, speaks with everyone about a night that still haunts them years later. It’s a series about race and policing, mislaid justice, cutting-edge science, and the kinds of weighty choices that cops and prosecutors make every day -- choices that, once made, are difficult to reverse. Listen to SUSPECT: http://wondery.fm/Suspect_LifeLindseys
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

There's so much celebrity gossip that it's impossible to keep up. From the twists and turns of #FreeBritney to the latest Royal family dust-up, there’s a new podcast that has you covered. From Wondery, RICH AND DAILY delivers laughs and all the latest celebrity gossip. Hosts Brooke and Aricia are comedians, besties and the perfect guides to give you your daily dose of pop culture. They'll keep you up to speed on all of the secrets, scandals, and news in the entertainment world. Is that rumor you heard about Rihanna true? If it is, you better believe Brooke and Aricia will have something to say about it. This is just a preview of Rich and Daily, but you can listen to full episodes at http://wondery.fm/RD_LifeWithLindseys.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Write the book! So often we get these great ideas to write a book but talk ourselves out of it because we don't think that what we have to share is valuable. Whether you believe it or not, your story is worth sharing and even has the power to transform another's life. Listen in to this week's episode of Life With the Lindsey's as Cornelius and Heather share some tips to get started and what it takes to complete the book!

We're talking rejection. Do you feel yourself chasing after approval? Is your career and relationships built off of solely receiving validation from others? Do you have this constant feeling of unworthiness? Where does this stem from? Listen in to this week’s episode of Life With the Lindseys as Cornelius and Heather share their own experiences with rejection and how not to let these experiences deter you from the real you. You're worth it!

items.title: Getting the Spark Back in Your Marriage

items.content:
REDFLAGS. We all have them. And when someone crosses those things we believe we absolutely can not put up with, we immediately want to throw them away. The truth of the matter is, we grow, we learn, and we change. Listen in to this week’s episode of Life With the Lindsey’s as Cornelius and Heather stress the importance of embracing what’s different or even difficult. What appears to be unbearable or unattractive now could very well be a blessing!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

The truth of the matter is, we grow, we learn, and we change. Listen in to this week’s episode of Life With the Lindsey’s as Cornelius and Heather stress the importance of embracing what’s different or even difficult. What appears to be unbearable or unattractive now could very well be a blessing!
 
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.content:
There's value in REST. Every season calls for a time for us to pull back, rest, and get still before the Lord to know what the Holy Spirit is saying and what He wants to teach us. Listen in to this week's episode of Life With the Lindseys to hear from Cornelius and Heather about the importance of rest and sensitivity to the Spirit so that we aren't getting ahead of God or running ourselves dry. Also, stay tuned to the end for an exciting and spontaneous interview featuring Logan and Taylor Lindsey!

items.content:
Do you believe in marriage at first sight? In this week's episode of Life with the Lindseys, Cornelius and Heather share their thoughts about the beginning stages of dating and getting to know someone new. While many of us may struggle with rejection, unrealistic expectations, and more, Cornelius and Heather share some advice to help navigate these challenges to not miss out on the person that God has for you.

items.title: Who's Running the House?

items.content:
So often we internalize and suppress how we're feeling. It's difficult sometimes for us to be honest out of fear of being judged. In this episode of Life With the Lindseys, Cornelius and Heather share the beauty in vulnerability and being willing to expose our hurts to receive the help and healing that we need.

items.title: Dating In 2020

items.content:
Whether we want to accept it or not, the developing outcomes of Coronavirus are affecting each of us. Many of us are being forced to spend more time at home, work from home, step in as teacher for our children, assess our businesses and different ways we can make up for lost income, and more - all of which have called us to create a new normal in our lives. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of using this as an opportunity to examine our hearts, to draw nearer to the Father, to get more involved with family and loved ones, and more!Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Creating a New Normal

items.content:
Whatever you focus on will become your reality. If you focus on the reports of the news then you’ll be filled with fear. And you’ll feel alone, scared and abandoned if you’re without a proper covering. When you’re scared, you’re either not covered or don’t understand how you’re being covered. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of being covered and never being afraid.Sponsored By:Liquid IVGo to liquidiv.com and enter promo code LWL to save 25% and get better hydration.RitualGet 10% off during your first three months at ritual.com/LWLLearn more about your ad choices. items.title: I'm Covered So I Ain't Never Scared

items.content:
Life is full of ups and downs, successes and failures and encouragement and discouragement. The goal is to discover a happy middle point of contentment so bad days don't break you and good days don't make you. Heather and Cornelius answer the age-old question: "How do I trust when I don't understand?" With life hitting us in every direction, we oftentimes don't know what to do. Join them as they tell you how to trust when you don't understand.Sponsored By:Best FiendsDownload Best Fiends FREE on the Apple App Store or Google PlayPolicy GeniusIn just a few minutes you can find your best price and apply at Policygenius.comHello FreshGo to HelloFresh.com/lwl10 and use code lwl10 for 10 free meals including free shippingLearn more about your ad choices. items.title: Church Hurt

items.content:
Breaking up can be hard to do. Some situations warrant it, but there are times when we fail to realize just how afraid we are of truly committing ourselves to a relationship. Listen as the Lindseys share their story on what led to them breaking up a month after they started courting. They also share some tips on noticing red flags, healing after breaking up and knowing when to ask for forgiveness after ending a relationship prematurely.Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Single and Dissatisfied

items.content:
In marriage, there can exist three kinds of rings--an engagement ring, a wedding ring and suffering. Unfortunately, more and more couples are experiencing a great deal of suffering. In this episode, we share our personal marriage story. We share some things that we've never shared publicly before. Ultimately, everyone from singles to married couples will get something out of this because we've all felt the sting of unsatisfaction. Singles can learn some things about marriage and married folks can be encouraged through our honesty.Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

items.title: Meet the Lindseys

items.content:
This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor. New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe Today!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
